tn.ref: man injured by crushing or cutting off
tn.text: "man whose private body parts someone has crushed or cut off"

tn.ref: may enter the assembly of Yahweh
tn.text: This is an idiom. AT: "may be a full member of the Israelite community" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: illegitimate child
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) a child born to parents who committed incest or adultery or 2) a child born to a prostitute.

tn.ref: as far as to the tenth generation of his descendants
tn.text: This "tenth" is the ordinal number for ten. AT: "even after ten generations of the illegitimate child's descendants" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: none of them
tn.text: "none of these descendants"

tn.ref: may not belong to the assembly of Yahweh
tn.text: This is an idiom. AT: "may not be a full member of the Israelite community" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: as far as to the tenth generation of his descendants
tn.text: This "tenth"is the ordinal number for ten. AT: "even after ten generations of his descendants" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: they did not meet you with bread and with water
tn.text: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "they did not welcome you by bringing you food and drink" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: against you ... curse you
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the word "you" here is singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: would not listen
tn.text: This is an idiom. AT: "did not pay attention" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: turned the curse into a blessing for you
tn.text: "had him bless you and not curse you"

tn.ref: You must never seek their peace or prosperity
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "You should never make a peace treaty with the Ammonites and the Moabites" or 2) "You must not do anything to cause things to go well for those 2 people groups to enable them to prosper" (UDB).

tn.ref: during all your days
tn.text: This is an idiom. AT: "as long as you are a nation" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: You must not detest an Edomite
tn.text: "Do not hate an Edomite"

tn.ref: for he is your brother
tn.text: "because he is your relative"

tn.ref: you must not abhor an Egyptian
tn.text: "do not hate an Egyptian"

tn.ref: The descendants of the third generation that are born to them may belong to the assembly of Yahweh
tn.text: This "third" is the ordinal number for three. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "If an Edomite or an Egyptian comes to live in the Israelite community, his grandchildren may become full members of that community" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: When you march out as an army against your enemies, then you must keep yourselves
tn.text: Moses speaks here to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: against your enemies
tn.text: "to fight against your enemies"

tn.ref: keep yourselves from every evil thing
tn.text: "keep yourselves away from all bad things"

tn.ref: any man who is unclean because of what happened to him at night
tn.text: This is a polite way of saying that he had an emission of semen. AT: "any man who is unclean because he had an emission of semen while he was asleep" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: and you will have something among your tools to dig with
tn.text: "and you should have a tool that you can use to dig with"

tn.ref: when you squat down to relieve yourself
tn.text: This is a polite way of saying to defecate. AT: "when you squat down to defecate" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

tn.ref: you must dig with it
tn.text: "you must dig a hole with the tool"

tn.ref: cover up what has come out from you
tn.text: "cover up your excrement"

tn.ref: so that he may not see any unclean thing among you
tn.text: "so that Yahweh may not see any unclean thing among you"

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: a slave who has escaped from his master
tn.text: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "a slave from another country who escaped from his master and came to Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] )

tn.ref: Let him live with you
tn.text: "Let the slave live among your people"

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: cultic prostitute ... cultic prostitute ... prostitute ... dog
tn.text: Yahweh gives a complete list of both forms of prostitution by both men and women to forbid prostitution by anyone for any reason. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

tn.ref: cultic prostitute ... among any of the daughters ... among the sons
tn.text: Possible meanings are that Moses 1) openly forbids women and men to perform sexual acts as part of temple service or 2) uses a euphemism to forbid women and men to perform sexual acts to receive money. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

tn.ref: You must not bring the wages of a prostitute ... into the house
tn.text: "A woman who earns money as a prostitute must not bring that money ... into the house"

tn.ref: a dog
tn.text: a man who allows men to have sex with him for money

tn.ref: into the house of Yahweh your God
tn.text: "into the temple"

tn.ref: for any vow
tn.text: "to fulfill a vow"

tn.ref: both these
tn.text: the wages of a female prostitute and of a male prostitute.

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: You must not lend on interest to your fellow Israelite
tn.text: "If you lend something to your fellow Israelite, you must not make him pay you back more than he borrowed"

tn.ref: lend on interest
tn.text: to lend to somebody and force that person to pay back more than was lent

tn.ref: interest of money ... anything that is lent on interest
tn.text: "you must not charge interest when you lend somebody money, food, or anything else"

tn.ref: all that you put your hand to
tn.text: This is an idiom. AT: "all that you do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: you must not be slow in fulfilling it
tn.text: "you must not take a long time to fulfill the vow"

tn.ref: for Yahweh your God will surely require it of you
tn.text: "because Yahweh your God will blame you and punish you if you do not fulfill your vow"

tn.ref: But if you will refrain from making a vow, it will be no sin for you
tn.text: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "But, if you do not make a vow, you will not sin because you will not have a vow to fulfill" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: That which has gone out from your lips
tn.text: This is an idiom. AT: "The words you have spoken" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: according as you have vowed to Yahweh your God
tn.text: "whatever you have vowed to Yahweh your God that you will do"

tn.ref: anything that you have freely promised with your mouth
tn.text: "anything that people have heard you promise to do because you wanted to do it"

tn.ref: with your mouth
tn.text: "so that people heard you say it"

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: you may eat as many grapes as you desire
tn.text: "then you may enjoy eating grapes until you are full"

tn.ref: but do not put any in your basket
tn.text: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "but you may not put any grapes in your bag to take them away with you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: When you go into your neighbor's ripe grain
tn.text: "When you walk through your neighbor's field where there is grain growing"

tn.ref: you may pluck the heads of grain with your hand
tn.text: "then you may eat the kernels of grain with your hand"

tn.ref: but do not put a sickle to your neighbor's ripe grain
tn.text: "but do not cut down your neighbor's ripe grain and take it with you"

tn.ref: sickle
tn.text: a sharp tool that farmers use to harvest wheat
